tags: remember when arya was consistently written as a human with complex layers
summary: hey game of thrones, d’you remember in season 3 episode 9 you had arya pleading with the hound not to kill the man with the meat...
body:
hey game of thrones, d’you remember in season 3 episode 9 you had arya pleading with the hound not to kill the man with the meat wagon? because she didn’t see why he should die? because she didn’t see the point in killing mindlessly with no purpose?

and arya got told by the hound, “you’re too kind”??

yeah, CAN U TELL ME WHY YOU THOUGHT ABANDONING THAT ARYA, THE REAL ARYA, IN YOUR WRITING WAS A GOOD IDEA

summary: The fact that the Starks are a loving family (especially by Westeros standards) doesn’t mean that its members don’t face...
body:
The fact that the Starks are a loving family (especially by Westeros standards) doesn’t mean that its members don’t face problems and that everything is sunshine and rainbows in Winterfell.

When it comes to Arya, she can be part of a loving family and at the same time be a victim of bullying (not only by outsiders but also by members of the said family)  She can  have supportive people in her life and still have self confidence issues thanks to those who belittle her (both minors and adults).

These things aren’t mutually exclusive.

summary: The Birds sing once more by AzraelGFG         |         Chapter 31: Arya
title: The Birds sing once more by AzraelGFG         |         Chapter 31: Arya
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
As soon as she had heard that women were allowed to participate she simply had to participate.

She would show everybody that a woman could just be as good as a man when it came to fighting.

Gods, she would show them all what she was capable of. And the whole journey south she couldn’t wait to see the faces of the men she would be beating.

And so far she had been able to keep up to her own expectations.

summary: After the turmoils of travel, back to normal (I hope) with my on-going time-travel fix-it fic “This Time, We’ll Do Better”. This...
caption:
After the turmoils of travel, back to normal (I hope) with my on-going time-travel fix-it fic “This Time, We’ll Do Better”. This time is it Catelyn, who else, the one and only “Mother of Wolves”…

Catelyn leaned back. With formalities concluded, she was free to ask what she really wanted to know.

“What do you plan to do next? You told me once that when you first came to us, you intended to offer your services to House Stark. Would that still be of interest to you? As if it is, I can assure you that you would be warmly welcomed and my husband would be proud to have you wearing our colours. Saying that, if this experience has discouraged you from that notion, I understand completely.”

Thank you @hardlyfatal for patiently continuing to beta this behemoth!

summary: Daenerys, texting: Missandei isn’t home and I forgot the common tongue word for this thing and its bAD she usually helps but i...
body:
Daenerys, texting: Missandei isn’t home and I forgot the common tongue word for this thing and its bAD she usually helps but i cANT

Arya, texting back: i will assist???

Daenerys: you know that little sea bug with the stupid hands and it has a home but it changes homes sometimes because it gets too big for it?? what is it???

Arya: hermit crab?

Daenerys: THATS THE BITCH

summary: I think it's very noticeable how Baela Targaryen and Arya share many parallels: they make friends with smallfolks easily (from...
question: I think it's very noticeable how Baela Targaryen and Arya share many parallels: they make friends with smallfolks easily (from boys to women from brothels), become acquainted to a castle to the point of escaping from the enemy's soldiers, have a special bond with a magical animal, are "unladylike" and have a "ladylike" sister, are wild, spontaneous, full of energy and ultimately loyal, advocating passionately for justice for the people they love. Also, y'know, Baela ran off to marry a...
answer:
… legitimized bastard. Could this be a good sign for Arya/Gendry in the future? I thought there were too many similarities to not point them out.             

Oh, and they also use their mothers’ names in homage to them (Arya for herself in the HoB&W, Baela for her daughter) and are intent on killing for vengeance (Arya has a list but still needs to follow through with it and Baela probably had grandma Rhaenys in mind when she attacked Aegon II).            

Yes, the parallels here are very strong. Very easy to see Arya in Baela, although Baela does have her differences as well. (Very different family situation especially re the personalities of her parents, the whole Targ thing and all; and Baela, though older, is also more innocent than Arya as she doesn’t have her trauma or child soldier tropes.) But the way Baela and Rhaena are with the regency of their half-brother Aegon III, I can totally see that with Arya and Sansa and Rickon (or Bran if one prefers).

Regarding Arya/Gendry, Baela/Alyn could be a good sign? Although GRRM says that their marriage was “stormy”, which is a tad worrisome… but also things like “yet in the end they reconciled, as they always did.” Which is nice. :)  I would prefer to have details from F&B volume 2 before I was definite about it all, though. (Like, the varying accounts as to whether Alyn slept with Aliandra Martell are one thing, we still have the big question about his affair with Elaena Targaryen. Though I still strongly suspect it happened after Baela died, sigh.)

Nevertheless, Alyn being legitimized and made the heir to Driftmark is a point in favor of that plotpoint happening with Gendry and Storm’s End somehow. (Even if Edric Storm is the bastard of Robert far more likely to be preferred by the stormlords, being highborn on both sides, god knows if GRRM might do something terrible to him before that could come about.) But even Gendry being legitimized at all (with no Storm’s End) could be a big bonus for his potential relationship with Arya, whether she would care (she wouldn’t) or not (he would).

Either way… sigh, this is why I really wish F&B was a POV-based narrative, not a history book. I look forward to seeing what ficcers do with the parallels here, though, and of course to whatever GRRM eventually does. :)

reblog.comment:

But even Gendry being legitimized at all (with no Storm’s End) could be a big bonus for his potential relationship with Arya, whether she would care (she wouldn’t) or not (he would).

Either way… sigh, this is why I really wish F&B was a POV-based narrative, not a history book. I look forward to seeing what ficcers do with the parallels here, though, and of course to whatever GRRM eventually does. :)

trail.content_raw:
… legitimized bastard. Could this be a good sign for Arya/Gendry in the future? I thought there were too many similarities to not point them out.             

Oh, and they also use their mothers’ names in homage to them (Arya for herself in the HoB&W, Baela for her daughter) and are intent on killing for vengeance (Arya has a list but still needs to follow through with it and Baela probably had grandma Rhaenys in mind when she attacked Aegon II).            

Yes, the parallels here are very strong. Very easy to see Arya in Baela, although Baela does have her differences as well. (Very different family situation especially re the personalities of her parents, the whole Targ thing and all; and Baela, though older, is also more innocent than Arya as she doesn’t have her trauma or child soldier tropes.) But the way Baela and Rhaena are with the regency of their half-brother Aegon III, I can totally see that with Arya and Sansa and Rickon (or Bran if one prefers).

Regarding Arya/Gendry, Baela/Alyn could be a good sign? Although GRRM says that their marriage was “stormy”, which is a tad worrisome… but also things like “yet in the end they reconciled, as they always did.” Which is nice. :)  I would prefer to have details from F&B volume 2 before I was definite about it all, though. (Like, the varying accounts as to whether Alyn slept with Aliandra Martell are one thing, we still have the big question about his affair with Elaena Targaryen. Though I still strongly suspect it happened after Baela died, sigh.)

Nevertheless, Alyn being legitimized and made the heir to Driftmark is a point in favor of that plotpoint happening with Gendry and Storm’s End somehow. (Even if Edric Storm is the bastard of Robert far more likely to be preferred by the stormlords, being highborn on both sides, god knows if GRRM might do something terrible to him before that could come about.) But even Gendry being legitimized at all (with no Storm’s End) could be a big bonus for his potential relationship with Arya, whether she would care (she wouldn’t) or not (he would).

Either way… sigh, this is why I really wish F&B was a POV-based narrative, not a history book. I look forward to seeing what ficcers do with the parallels here, though, and of course to whatever GRRM eventually does. :)
trail.content:

Oh, and they also use their mothers’ names in homage to them (Arya for herself in the HoB&W, Baela for her daughter) and are intent on killing for vengeance (Arya has a list but still needs to follow through with it and Baela probably had grandma Rhaenys in mind when she attacked Aegon II).            

Yes, the parallels here are very strong. Very easy to see Arya in Baela, although Baela does have her differences as well. (Very different family situation especially re the personalities of her parents, the whole Targ thing and all; and Baela, though older, is also more innocent than Arya as she doesn’t have her trauma or child soldier tropes.) But the way Baela and Rhaena are with the regency of their half-brother Aegon III, I can totally see that with Arya and Sansa and Rickon (or Bran if one prefers).

(Like, the varying accounts as to whether Alyn slept with Aliandra Martell are one thing, we still have the big question about his affair with Elaena Targaryen. Nevertheless, Alyn being legitimized and made the heir to Driftmark is a point in favor of that plotpoint happening with Gendry and Storm’s End somehow. blog.description:
Hey, you can call me Mindset, or Butterfly.
I like: Comics, ASOIAF, music, art, books, sf & fantasy, butterflies, birds, pretty rocks, and many other things. See my sidebar tags and links for more details.
I help mod: ASOIAF University and A Song of Theories.
Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

summary: hello again wonderful cutie, I want to do some Dany/Sansa/Arya having a good time fanart, what are some activities I could draw...
question: hello again wonderful cutie, I want to do some Dany/Sansa/Arya having a good time fanart, what are some activities I could draw them doing? the only thing that comes to mind is having tea but I don't know much about how they would pass their time or company. Hope the wrist is better, have a nice day!
answer:
Here’s a good list of pastimes, some of which may be harder to draw than others I’m afraid. But tea is good – playing cyvasse is also good (Arya might be fascinated or frustrated by the strategy), or tiles (dominoes), or other table games like that. Hawking is fun (Catelyn promised Arya she could have her own hawk when she was older), though not sure if Dany might get interrupted by a dragon snatching her prey. ;)  Another option could be watching plays or performers, something non-offensive; or heck, Arya could perform while Sansa sings and plays, something like that.

And oh, if they’re in Winterfell, bathing in the hot pools could be a fun time – those are in the godswood, near the wall of the castle, I imagine when noble ladies are using them they probably encircle the area with sheets or something. But Sansa and Arya grew up swimming in the pools, and we all know Dany loves hot baths, so that could be perfect, yeah? Anyway, hope you find something you like!

summary: I did not make the rules by BMike22 “Why aren’t you down in the yard?” Arya asked him.  He gave her a half smile. “Bastards are...
caption:
I did not make the rules by BMike22

“Why aren’t you down in the yard?” Arya asked him.

He gave her a half smile. “Bastards are not allowed to damage young princes,” he said. “Any bruises they take in the practice yard must come from trueborn swords.”

“Oh.” Arya felt abashed. She should have realized. For the second time today, Arya reflected that life was not fair.

She watched her little brother whack at Tommen. “I could do just as good as Bran,” she said. “He’s only seven. I’m nine.”

Jon looked her over with all his fourteen-year-old wisdom. “You’re too skinny,” he said. He took her arm to feel her muscle. Then he sighed and shook his head. “I doubt you could even lift a longsword, little sister, never mind swing one.”

Arya snatched back her arm and glared at him. Jon messed up her hair again. They watched Bran and Tommen circle each other.

“You see Prince Joffrey?” Jon asked.

She hadn’t, not at first glance, but when she looked again she found him to the back, under the shade of the high stone wall. He was surrounded by men she did not recognize, young squires in the livery of Lannister and Baratheon, strangers all. There were a few older men among them; knights, she surmised.

“Look at the arms on his surcoat,” Jon suggested.

Arya looked. An ornate shield had been embroidered on the prince’s padded surcoat. No doubt the needlework was exquisite. The arms were divided down the middle; on one side was the crowned stag of the royal House, on the other the lion of Lannister.

“The Lannisters are proud,” Jon observed. “You’d think the royal sigil would be sufficient, but no. He makes his mother’s House equal in honor to the king’s.”

“The woman is important too!” Arya protested.

Jon chuckled. “Perhaps you should do the same thing, little sister. Wed Tully to Stark in your arms.”

“A wolf with a fish in its mouth?” It made her laugh. “That would look silly. Besides, if a girl can’t fight, why should she have a coat of arms?”

Jon shrugged. “Girls get the arms but not the swords. Bastards get the swords but not the arms. I did not make the rules, little sister.” - AGoT Arya I
